intro: Calyptrostegia menkeana, commonly known as the Menke's rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils, often found in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are borne on slender stems. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. Calyptrostegia menkeana is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
